translated: As the Bhagavān said in the noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines:

original: bdag gis sems can thams cad phung po lhag ma med par mya ngan las 'das par yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar bgyi ba'i gang dang gang yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar bya ba de yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag gis sems can thams cad phung po lhag ma med par mya ngan las 'das par yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar bgyi ba'i gang dang gang yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar bya ba de yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: “I should lead all sentient beings to complete nirvāṇa in the realm of nirvāṇa without remainder. But that which is to be led to complete nirvāṇa does not exist.”

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi sgra dbyangs mtha' yas pas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dang mtshungs pa'i bskal par yang sems can zhes tshig tu brjod kyang /🔽de la gang cung zad skyes pa'am skye bar 'gyur ba'am //
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi sgra dbyangs mtha' yas pas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dang mtshungs pa'i bskal par yang sems can zhes tshig tu brjod kyang / de la gang cung zad skyes pa'am skye bar 'gyur ba'am //
translated: If the infinite melody of the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones were to speak for eons equal to the sands of the Ganges River about the word “sentient beings,”🔽there would be nothing whatsoever that arises, has arisen,

original: skye ba'am 'gags pa'am /
analyzed: skye ba'am 'gags pa'am /
translated: or will arise;🔽nothing that ceases, has ceased,

original: 'gags par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: 'gags par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: or will cease.

original: 'gag pa ni sems can gyi khams rnams gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'gag pa ni sems can gyi khams rnams gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because the realms of sentient beings are primordially unborn.

original: / de na yang gang skye ba dang 'gag pa mi dmigs pa de bsgral bar bgyi'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: / de na yang gang skye ba dang 'gag pa mi dmigs pa de bsgral bar bgyi'o zhes pa'o //
translated: And there, where arising and ceasing are not observed, one should liberate them.

original: 'di ni brdzun du smra ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni brdzun du smra ba'o //
translated: This is false speech.

original: tshig ni brdzun gyi ched du ste /
analyzed: tshig ni brdzun gyi ched du ste /
translated: Words are for the sake of falsehood.

original: 'di lta bu 'di ni yang dag pa bden pa'i brdzun du smra ba'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu 'di ni yang dag pa bden pa'i brdzun du smra ba'o //
translated: This is the true, truthful false speech.

original: yang na smra ba ni sgra ste brdzun ni mi bden pa'o //
analyzed: yang na smra ba ni sgra ste brdzun ni mi bden pa'o //
translated: Or, speech is sound, and false means untrue.

original: gang gi phyir smra ba 'di ni byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir smra ba 'di ni byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: Because this speech is the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: aa bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: aa bdag med ma'o //
translated: A is Nairātmya.

original: de ltar gnyi ga'o //
analyzed: de ltar gnyi ga'o //
translated: Thus both.

original: de yang byin nas gtong bas na smra ba ste /
analyzed: de yang byin nas gtong bas na smra ba ste /
translated: And that, having given, is speech.

original: stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin gang sgra n'a da'i phreng gnyis so //🔽de dbyer med par rtogs pa yongs su spangs pa yang brdzun te dbang po las @168a * //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin gang sgra n'a da'i phreng gnyis so // de dbyer med par rtogs pa yongs su spangs pa yang brdzun te dbang po las @168a * //
translated: The nature of the Thought of Enlightenment, which is the indivisibility of emptiness and compassion, is the two garlands of nāda.

original: 'das pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The abandonment of that indivisibility is also false, because it is a matter beyond the senses.

original: gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: rab 'byor gal te mya ngan las 'das pa las cung zad ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos gcig yod na yang bdag sgyu ma lta bu rim lam lta bu'o zhes gsungs pa de ni brdzun du smra ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te mya ngan las 'das pa las cung zad ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos gcig yod na yang bdag sgyu ma lta bu rim lam lta bu'o zhes gsungs pa de ni brdzun du smra ba'i tshig go //
translated: “Subhūti, if there were even a phenomenon the slightest bit superior to nirvāṇa, I would say it is like an illusion, like a dream.”

original: btsun mo'i khu ba ma byin pa ni gzhan gyi nor 'phrog pa ma byin par len pa yin no //
analyzed: btsun mo'i khu ba ma byin pa ni gzhan gyi nor 'phrog pa ma byin par len pa yin no //
translated: The semen of the queen is the taking of what is not given, the appropriation of another’s property.

original: yang na btsun mo ni bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: yang na btsun mo ni bdag med ma'o //
translated: Or else, the queen is Nairātmya.

original: khu ba ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: khu ba ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The semen is the Vajra Holder.

original: btsun mo yang yin la khu ba yang yin pas btsun mo'i khu ba'o //
analyzed: btsun mo yang yin la khu ba yang yin pas btsun mo'i khu ba'o //
translated: Since she is a queen and also semen, she is the queen's semen.

original: de ma byin pa ni ma btang ba ste rtag tu 'byung ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma byin pa ni ma btang ba ste rtag tu 'byung ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Not giving that is not releasing it, because of the nature of its constant emission.

original: gzhan gyi bud med ces pa ni mchog gi shes rab ma'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bud med ces pa ni mchog gi shes rab ma'o //
translated: The other's woman is the supreme wisdom woman.

original: de rang 'od mdzes ni rang gis smras ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de rang 'od mdzes ni rang gis smras ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Her own light is beautiful, and her own speech is the Vajra Holder.

original: de'i rang ni de'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab ma'o //
analyzed: de'i rang ni de'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab ma'o //
translated: Her own is the nature of the wisdom woman.

original: mdzes pa ni kun las mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdzes pa ni kun las mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Beauty is supreme over all.

original: rdo rje snying pos rnal 'byor ma thams cad la bzod pa gsol nas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la sogs pa'i don zhus pa la zhus pa'i lan bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje snying pos rnal 'byor ma thams cad la bzod pa gsol nas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la sogs pa'i don zhus pa la zhus pa'i lan bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa yin no //
translated: The Vajra Essence, having requested forbearance from all yoginis, asked about the meaning of the mandala wheel, etc. The Blessed One's reply is as follows.

original: da ni bdag med ma la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma cha med pa'i rang bzhin rnams dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la sogs pa'i thabs de rnams la the tshom du gyur te /
analyzed: da ni bdag med ma la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma cha med pa'i rang bzhin rnams dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la sogs pa'i thabs de rnams la the tshom du gyur te /
translated: Now, the yoginis such as Nairatmya, who are of the nature of the indivisible parts, have doubts about those methods such as the mandala wheel, etc.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la sogs pa yang kun rdzob kyi bden pa yang dbyer med pa'i don dam pa'i bden par bcom ldan 'das kyis brda gsungs pa la rnal 'byor ma rnams the tshom du gyur te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la sogs pa yang kun rdzob kyi bden pa yang dbyer med pa'i don dam pa'i bden par bcom ldan 'das kyis brda gsungs pa la rnal 'byor ma rnams the tshom du gyur te /
translated: The mandala wheel, etc., are also the ultimate truth, which is the indivisible conventional truth. The Bhagavat has spoken the symbolic language. The yoginis have doubts about that.

original: bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
translated: They ask the Bhagavat.

original: de nas rnal 'byor ma thams cad kyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas rnal 'byor ma thams cad kyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then, all the yoginis said this to the Bhagavat.

original: de nas zhes pa ni kha sbyor ro //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa ni kha sbyor ro //
translated: Then means union.

original: rnal 'byor ma thams cad ces pa ni ma lus pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa rnams so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma thams cad ces pa ni ma lus pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa rnams so //
translated: All the yoginis means those endowed with all the yogas.

original: 'di skad ces gsol to zhes pa ni 'di lta bu'i rnam pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis dus gsum du khyab pa'o //
analyzed: 'di skad ces gsol to zhes pa ni 'di lta bu'i rnam pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis dus gsum du khyab pa'o //
translated: They said this means that the nature of such a form pervades the three times.

original: zhus pa nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhus pa nyid gsungs pa /
translated: The question itself is stated.

original: yul de rnams kyang ci lags /🔽dbang po rnams ni gang lags /
analyzed: yul de rnams kyang ci lags / dbang po rnams ni gang lags /
translated: What are those objects?🔽What are the sense faculties?

original: skye mched rnams ni ci lags //🔽phung po rnams ni gang lags /
analyzed: skye mched rnams ni ci lags // phung po rnams ni gang lags /
translated: What are the sense bases?🔽What are the aggregates?

original: khams rnams de yang ci lags /
analyzed: khams rnams de yang ci lags /
translated: What are the elements?

original: de ltar lnga'i bdag nyid kun rdzob kyi bden pa 'di rnams kyi rang bzhin shes pa don dam pa'i bden pa yin par rnal 'byor ma rnams bgros @168b nas zhus pa de la /
analyzed: de ltar lnga'i bdag nyid kun rdzob kyi bden pa 'di rnams kyi rang bzhin shes pa don dam pa'i bden pa yin par rnal 'byor ma rnams bgros @168b nas zhus pa de la /
translated: Thus, the nature of these conventional truths, which have the nature of the five, is ultimate truth.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān replied to the yoginīs’ question:

original: yul drug ni /
analyzed: yul drug ni /
translated: “The six objects

original: gzugs sgra de bzhin dri dang ni //
analyzed: gzugs sgra de bzhin dri dang ni //
translated: are form, sound, and likewise smell,

original: ro dang de bzhin reg bya nyid //
analyzed: ro dang de bzhin reg bya nyid //
translated: taste, and likewise touch,

original: chos kyi khams kyi rang bzhin nyid //
analyzed: chos kyi khams kyi rang bzhin nyid //
translated: and the nature of the phenomena element.

original: 'di rnams yul ni drug tu brjod //
analyzed: 'di rnams yul ni drug tu brjod //
translated: These are said to be the six objects.

original: dbang po rnams ni yul drug ste //
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni yul drug ste //
translated: The six sense faculties are the six objects,

original: mig dang rna ba sna dang ni //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba sna dang ni //
translated: the eyes, ears, nose,

original: lce dang lus dang de bzhin yid //
analyzed: lce dang lus dang de bzhin yid //
translated: tongue, body, and likewise the mind.

original: 'di rnams dbang po drug po ni //
analyzed: 'di rnams dbang po drug po ni //
translated: These six sense faculties

original: gti mug rdo rje la sogs ldan //
analyzed: gti mug rdo rje la sogs ldan //
translated: are endowed with Mohavajrā and so on.

original: yul dang yul can dag gis ni //
analyzed: yul dang yul can dag gis ni //
translated: The objects and the subjects

original: skye mched bcu gnyis dag tu 'gyur //
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis dag tu 'gyur //
translated: The twelve sense-spheres are formed.

original: phung po lnga ni gzugs la sogs //
analyzed: phung po lnga ni gzugs la sogs //
translated: The five aggregates are form and so forth,

original: mthar ni rnam shes snying rje che //
analyzed: mthar ni rnam shes snying rje che //
translated: and finally consciousness, great compassion.

original: dbang po dang ni yul nyid dang // dbang po'i rnam par shes pa nyid //
analyzed: dbang po dang ni yul nyid dang // dbang po'i rnam par shes pa nyid //
translated: The faculties, the objects, and the faculties' consciousnesses,

original: rnal 'byor ma rnams go bya'i phyir //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma rnams go bya'i phyir //
translated: are explained for the yoginīs to understand.

original: khams ni bco brgyad rnams su bshad //
analyzed: khams ni bco brgyad rnams su bshad //
translated: The elements are explained as eighteen.

original: rang bzhin gdod nas ma skyes pa //
analyzed: rang bzhin gdod nas ma skyes pa //
translated: The nature is primordially unborn,

original: bden min brdzun min de bzhin du //
analyzed: bden min brdzun min de bzhin du //
translated: not true, not false, and likewise,

original: thams cad chu yi zla ba ltar //
analyzed: thams cad chu yi zla ba ltar //
translated: all is like the moon in the water.

original: 'dod pa rnal 'byor mas shes kyis //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnal 'byor mas shes kyis //
translated: Know desire, O yoginī.

original: 'di lta ste gtsub shing dang gtsub stan dang skyes bu'i lag pa'i rtsol ba las glo bur du me skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste gtsub shing dang gtsub stan dang skyes bu'i lag pa'i rtsol ba las glo bur du me skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, fire arises suddenly from the rubbing stick, the fire-drilling stick, and the effort of the person's hand.

original: me 'di ni gtsub shing la yang mi gnas gtsub stan la yang ma yin skyes bu'i lag pa la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: me 'di ni gtsub shing la yang mi gnas gtsub stan la yang ma yin skyes bu'i lag pa la yang ma yin te /
translated: This fire does not exist in the rubbing stick, nor in the fire-drilling stick, nor in the person's hand.

original: rnam pa thams cad du yongs su btsal na gcig na yang yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du yongs su btsal na gcig na yang yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: When thoroughly investigated in every way, it is not found to exist anywhere.

original: me de yang bden pa yang ma yin zhing brdzun pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: me de yang bden pa yang ma yin zhing brdzun pa yang ma yin no //
translated: That fire is neither true nor false.🔽Thus, O Yoginī, contemplate all phenomena.

original: de ltar chos thams cad rnal 'byor mas yid la gyis shig ces pa ni rdo rje snying po thabs kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rang bzhin don dam pa'i bden pas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad rnal 'byor mas yid la gyis shig ces pa ni rdo rje snying po thabs kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rang bzhin don dam pa'i bden pas bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching of the ultimate truth, the nature of the relative truth, which is the nature of the vajra essence, the nature of method.

original: thams cad chu yi zla ba ltar //
analyzed: thams cad chu yi zla ba ltar //
translated: Everything is like the moon in the water.

original: 'dod pas rnal 'byor mas shes kyis ;
analyzed: 'dod pas rnal 'byor mas shes kyis ;
translated: The Yoginī should understand through desire.

original: /'di lta ste /
analyzed: /'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: gtsub shing dang / gtsub stan dang / skyes bu'i lag pa'i rtsol ba las glo bur du me skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtsub shing dang / gtsub stan dang / skyes bu'i lag pa'i rtsol ba las glo bur du me skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From the rubbing stick, the rubbing board, and the effort of the person's hands, fire suddenly arises.

original: me de yang gtsub shing la yang mi gnas //
analyzed: me de yang gtsub shing la yang mi gnas //
translated: That fire does not exist in the rubbing stick,

original: gtsub bstan la yang ma yin skyes bu'i lag pa dag la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtsub bstan la yang ma yin skyes bu'i lag pa dag la yang ma yin te /
translated: nor in the rubbing board, nor in the person's hands,🔽nor in the space in between.

original: rnal 'byor ma rnams ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyi don dam pa'i bden pa'i rang bzhin kun rdzob kyi bden par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyi bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma rnams ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyi don dam pa'i bden pa'i rang bzhin kun rdzob kyi bden par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyi bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The yoginis are the nature of wisdom, and the ultimate truth, which the Bhagavat has taught as the nature of conventional truth, is the summarized meaning of the verses.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di rnams rgyud kyi gleng gzhir gyur pa'i don dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i rgyud kyi rdo rje rigs kyi rim par phye ba'i @169a * //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di rnams rgyud kyi gleng gzhir gyur pa'i don dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i rgyud kyi rdo rje rigs kyi rim par phye ba'i @169a * //
translated: The meaning of these verses is the nidana of the tantra, which is the stage of the Vajra Family of the Hevajra Tantra,

original: bdag nyid nas rdzogs pa la thug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid nas rdzogs pa la thug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: from the nature up to the completion.🔽The Bhagavat was asked by Vajra Heart, “What is the mandala wheel?”

original: rdo rje snying pos dkyil 'khor 'khor lo ci zhes bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa'i lan bcom ldan 'das kyis btab pa /
analyzed: rdo rje snying pos dkyil 'khor 'khor lo ci zhes bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa'i lan bcom ldan 'das kyis btab pa /
translated: The Bhagavat replied,

original: dkyil ni snying po zhes brjod de //
analyzed: dkyil ni snying po zhes brjod de //
translated: “The center is called the essence,

original: byang chub sems ni bde chen po //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni bde chen po //
translated: the mind of enlightenment is great bliss,

original: 'khor lo zhes tshogs nam mkha'i khams //
analyzed: 'khor lo zhes tshogs nam mkha'i khams //
translated: the wheel is the assembly of the realm of space,

original: yul la sogs pa rnam par sbyong //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa rnam par sbyong //
translated: purifying the objects and so forth.”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: And so forth.

original: de yang rdo rje snying pos ni thabs kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang rdo rje snying pos ni thabs kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, the Vajragarbha is the nature of method.

original: 'khor lo zhes tshogs nam mkha'i khams //🔽yul la sogs pa rnam par sbyong //
analyzed: 'khor lo zhes tshogs nam mkha'i khams // yul la sogs pa rnam par sbyong //
translated: The wheel is the assembly of the realm of space.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: It purifies the objects, and so forth.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pas bskyed pa'i rim pa rtogs par bzhed pa yin no //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pas bskyed pa'i rim pa rtogs par bzhed pa yin no //
translated: This is the understanding of the generation stage.

original: dkyil ni snying po zhes brjod do //🔽byang chub sems ni bde chen po //
analyzed: dkyil ni snying po zhes brjod do // byang chub sems ni bde chen po //
translated: The center is called the essence.

original: zhes pas ni /
analyzed: zhes pas ni /
translated: The mind of enlightenment is great bliss.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa dang bskyed pa'i rim pa phyin ci ma log pa bcom ldan 'das kyis dang po nyid du rdo rje snying pos zhus pa'i lan btab pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa dang bskyed pa'i rim pa phyin ci ma log pa bcom ldan 'das kyis dang po nyid du rdo rje snying pos zhus pa'i lan btab pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavān first answered the question of Vajragarbha, without error regarding the completion stage and the generation stage.🔽Now, since the yoginīs also have a nature that is partless, they are essenceless.

original: da ni rnal 'byor ma rnams kyang cha shas med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin med pa des na /
analyzed: da ni rnal 'byor ma rnams kyang cha shas med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin med pa des na /
translated: Therefore,

original: byang chub sems ni bde chen po //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni bde chen po //
translated: the mind of enlightenment is great bliss.

original: zhes pa bzhed pa nyid do //
analyzed: zhes pa bzhed pa nyid do //
translated: This is the assertion.

original: 'khor lo zhes tshogs nam mkha'i khams //
analyzed: 'khor lo zhes tshogs nam mkha'i khams //
translated: The wheel is the assembly of the realm of space.

original: yul la sogs pa rnam par spyod //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa rnam par spyod //
translated: It purifies the objects, and so forth.

original: zhes pa la the tshom du gyur pa nyid sems la bzhag nas yul de rnams kyang ci lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa dbu 'dri la ba sngon du 'gro bas zhus pa'i lan btab pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa la the tshom du gyur pa nyid sems la bzhag nas yul de rnams kyang ci lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa dbu 'dri la ba sngon du 'gro bas zhus pa'i lan btab pa ni /
translated: The reply to the question, preceded by the salutation, is as follows.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: yul drug ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yul drug ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The six objects are form and so forth.

original: de yang cis khyad 'phags she na /
analyzed: de yang cis khyad 'phags she na /
translated: And how are they distinguished?

original: gti mug rdo rje la sogs ldan te drug go //
analyzed: gti mug rdo rje la sogs ldan te drug go //
translated: They are endowed with Vajra Delusion and so forth, and are six.

original: gti mug ni rnam par snang mdzad rdo rje ma ning gi rim par gnas pa'i mkha' 'gro ma'o //
analyzed: gti mug ni rnam par snang mdzad rdo rje ma ning gi rim par gnas pa'i mkha' 'gro ma'o //
translated: Delusion is Vajra Nairātmya, the ḍākinī abiding in the stage of Vajradhara Vairocana.

original: gti mug kyang yin la rdo rje ma yang yin pas gtu mug rdo rje ma ning ngo //
analyzed: gti mug kyang yin la rdo rje ma yang yin pas gtu mug rdo rje ma ning ngo //
translated: She is both delusion and a vajra, so she is Vajra Delusion.

original: mig gi dbang po la gti mug rdo rje la sogs pa ni gti mug rdo rje la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po la gti mug rdo rje la sogs pa ni gti mug rdo rje la sogs pa'o //
translated: Vajra Delusion and so forth are Vajra Delusion and so forth.

original: des ldan pa ni /
analyzed: des ldan pa ni /
translated: Endowed with them means

original: 'dus nas mi phyed pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dus nas mi phyed pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: they have the nature of being assembled and inseparable.

original: de nyid kyi phyir lnga po drug pa'i khongs su gtogs shing dbyer med pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi yid ces pa ni brda'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir lnga po drug pa'i khongs su gtogs shing dbyer med pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi yid ces pa ni brda'o //
translated: Therefore, the five are included in the sixth, and the nature of the mind, which is the realm of phenomena, is the symbol.

original: yul 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yul 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not just the object,

original: dbang po rnams kyang gti mug @169b rdo rje la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyang gti mug @169b rdo rje la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: but the faculties are also endowed with Vajra Delusion and so forth.

original: yang na gti mug rdo rje la sogs ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga rnams dang rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang na gti mug rdo rje la sogs ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga rnams dang rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma bzhi ste /
translated: Alternatively, Vajra Delusion and so forth are the five Tathagatas and the four Vajra dakinis.

original: gti mug rdo rje la sogs ldan ni rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i mkha' 'gro ma bzhi 'byung ba chen po lnga'i rang bzhin gti mug la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga dang dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: gti mug rdo rje la sogs ldan ni rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i mkha' 'gro ma bzhi 'byung ba chen po lnga'i rang bzhin gti mug la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga dang dbyer med pa'o //
translated: Endowed with Vajra Delusion and so forth, the four dakinis Vajra Woman and so forth, which are the nature of the five great elements, are the five Tathagatas of delusion and so forth, inseparable from the five aggregates of form and so forth.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: phung po lnga ni gzugs la sogs //
analyzed: phung po lnga ni gzugs la sogs //
translated: The five aggregates are form and so forth,

original: mthar ni rnam shes snying rje che //
analyzed: mthar ni rnam shes snying rje che //
translated: and at the end is consciousness, great compassion.

original: zhes rdo rje snying po la bos pa ste /
analyzed: zhes rdo rje snying po la bos pa ste /
translated: This is addressed to Vajra Essence.

original: de ni the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because of doubt.

original: sa la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po lnga dang phung po lngas byin gyis brlabs pas nyi shu'i dbye ba dbyer med pa'o //🔽de yang gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga re re zhing yang rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lngas byin gyis brlabs pas rnam pa brgyar dbyer med pa yin no //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po lnga dang phung po lngas byin gyis brlabs pas nyi shu'i dbye ba dbyer med pa'o // de yang gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga re re zhing yang rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lngas byin gyis brlabs pas rnam pa brgyar dbyer med pa yin no //
translated: The five great elements, earth, etc., and the five aggregates are consecrated, and so there is no division into twenty.🔽Moreover, each of the five aggregates, form, etc., is consecrated by the five Tathagatas, Vairocana, etc., and so there is no division into one hundred.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po re re zhing yang rnam pa lngar phye bas na de thug pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po re re zhing yang rnam pa lngar phye bas na de thug pa med pa'o //
translated: And each of the five Tathagatas, Vairocana, etc., is divided into five aspects, and so on ad infinitum.

original: yul dang yul can dag gis ni //
analyzed: yul dang yul can dag gis ni //
translated: By the division of object and subject,

original: skye mched bcu gnyis dag tu 'gyur /
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis dag tu 'gyur /
translated: there are the twelve sense fields.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul drug dang mig la sogs pa'i dbang po drug dang gnyis po dag ni skye mched bcu gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul drug dang mig la sogs pa'i dbang po drug dang gnyis po dag ni skye mched bcu gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: The six objects, form, etc., and the six sense faculties, eye, etc., and both of these are the twelve sense fields.

original: yang na yul ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'o //
analyzed: yang na yul ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'o //
translated: Or else, the object is the four great elements.

original: yul can ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga rnams te /
analyzed: yul can ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga rnams te /
translated: The subjects are the five Tathagatas.

original: yul yang yin la yul can yang yin pas yul dang yul can te ma ning ngo //
analyzed: yul yang yin la yul can yang yin pas yul dang yul can te ma ning ngo //
translated: Since they are both objects and subjects, they are objects and subjects, that is, neuter.

original: de len cing 'dzin par byed pa'i nges pa'i tshig bstan pa na yi ge na dang yi ge la ste /
analyzed: de len cing 'dzin par byed pa'i nges pa'i tshig bstan pa na yi ge na dang yi ge la ste /
translated: When the verbal root of taking and holding is taught, it is the syllable na and the syllable la.

original: yul dang yul can de ston cing brjod pa yin pas yul dang yul can no //
analyzed: yul dang yul can de ston cing brjod pa yin pas yul dang yul can no //
translated: Since they teach and express those objects and subjects, they are objects and subjects.

original: de dag las thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin las so //
analyzed: de dag las thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin las so //
translated: From among those, from the nature of method and wisdom.

original: gang rang bzhin ni khams rnams te gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gang rang bzhin ni khams rnams te gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'o //
translated: That nature is the elements, which are primordially unborn.

original: rang gi dngos po ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rang gi dngos po ni rang bzhin no //
translated: One's own entity is one's nature.

original: khams ni bco brgyad dag tu bshad //
analyzed: khams ni bco brgyad dag tu bshad //
translated: The elements are explained as eighteen.

original: khams rnams ni sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba bzhi dang phung po lnga byin gyi brlabs pa dgu po nyis 'gyur bco brgyad do //
analyzed: khams rnams ni sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba bzhi dang phung po lnga byin gyi brlabs pa dgu po nyis 'gyur bco brgyad do //
translated: The elements are the four elements of earth, and so on, and the nine blessings of the five aggregates, which are eighteen in pairs.

original: rnal 'byor ma rnams ni bdag med ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma rnams ni bdag med ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: The yoginis are Nairatmya and so on.

original: go bya'i phyir ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //🔽rdo rje gsum dbyer med par @170a * //
analyzed: go bya'i phyir ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir ro // rdo rje gsum dbyer med par @170a * //
translated: In order to make them understand, in order to attain perfect complete enlightenment.

original: zhugs pas skye mched bcu gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhugs pas skye mched bcu gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: By entering into the indivisibility of the three vajras, there are twelve sense-fields.

original: du zhe na phung po ni gzugs la sogs dang sa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: du zhe na phung po ni gzugs la sogs dang sa la sogs pa'o //
translated: What are they? The aggregates are form, etc., and the elements are earth, etc.

original: 'du byed kyi mtha' zhes pa 'dis 'byung ba chen po bzhi yang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi mtha' zhes pa 'dis 'byung ba chen po bzhi yang bstan pa yin no //
translated: By the words “end of formations” the four great elements are also indicated.

original: 'dis ni dbang po lnga dang yul bzhi dang dgu'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni dbang po lnga dang yul bzhi dang dgu'o //
translated: By this [verse] there are five sense-faculties and four objects, making nine.

original: dbang po'i rnam pa shes pa nyid //
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam pa shes pa nyid //
translated: The sense-faculty aspect is consciousness itself.

original: ces pa ni /
analyzed: ces pa ni /
translated: This is said:

original: dbang po dang yul la rag las pa'i phyir yul dang dbang po dgu'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul la rag las pa'i phyir yul dang dbang po dgu'o //
translated: Because they depend on sense-faculties and objects, there are nine objects and sense-faculties.

original: 'dis ni dgu po gnyis po gang dang gang gi rang bzhin de ni ma ning ngo //
analyzed: 'dis ni dgu po gnyis po gang dang gang gi rang bzhin de ni ma ning ngo //
translated: By this [verse] the two sets of nine are whatever is the nature of each.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: gang 'di nyid gdod ma nas ma skyes pas so //
analyzed: gang 'di nyid gdod ma nas ma skyes pas so //
translated: From this very [fact] that they are primordially unborn.

original: gdod ma ni thog ma'o //
analyzed: gdod ma ni thog ma'o //
translated: Primordial is the beginning.

original: de nyid ma skyes pa ste gdod ma nas ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir thog ma med pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ma skyes pa ste gdod ma nas ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir thog ma med pa'o //
translated: It is without beginning, because it is unborn, because it is unborn by nature from the beginning.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bden min te bden pa bkag pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bden min te bden pa bkag pa'o //
translated: And for that very reason it is not real, because reality is excluded.

original: bden pa bkag pas pha rol dang tshu rol gyi rig pas brdzun pa bkag pa yin te brdzun min no //
analyzed: bden pa bkag pas pha rol dang tshu rol gyi rig pas brdzun pa bkag pa yin te brdzun min no //
translated: And because reality is excluded, unreality is excluded by the knowledge of the other side and this side, and so it is not unreal.

original: dpes cung zad phye nas byin gyis brlabs pas bstan par byas pa /
analyzed: dpes cung zad phye nas byin gyis brlabs pas bstan par byas pa /
translated: Having explained it a little by means of the example, he makes it known by means of the consecration.

original: thams cad chu yi zla ba ltar //
analyzed: thams cad chu yi zla ba ltar //
translated: All is like the moon in water.

original: 'dod pas rnal 'byor mas shes kyis //
analyzed: 'dod pas rnal 'byor mas shes kyis //
translated: The yoginī should know it through desire.

original: de lta bur gyur ba'i yongs su shes pa yang chags pa nyid yin pas chags pa thams cad las kyang bzlog pas ni don dam pa'i bden pa yang bstan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur ba'i yongs su shes pa yang chags pa nyid yin pas chags pa thams cad las kyang bzlog pas ni don dam pa'i bden pa yang bstan pa nyid yin no //
translated: And that kind of knowledge is also desire, so it is also taught that ultimate reality is to be turned away from all desires.

original: 'dod pas zhes pa ni yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pas zhes pa ni yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: Desire is knowledge.

original: 'dod pa ji ltar yin pa gsungs pa /🔽gtsub shing zhes pa ni gtsub pa'i shing ngo //
analyzed: 'dod pa ji ltar yin pa gsungs pa / gtsub shing zhes pa ni gtsub pa'i shing ngo //
translated: He says how desire is.🔽The kindling wood is the wood for kindling.

original: gtsub stan ni gtsub pa'i 'og gzhi'o //
analyzed: gtsub stan ni gtsub pa'i 'og gzhi'o //
translated: The hearth is the base for kindling.

original: skyes bu'i lag pa'i rtsol ba las zhes pa ni lag pa'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: skyes bu'i lag pa'i rtsol ba las zhes pa ni lag pa'i bya ba'o //
translated: “From the effort of the person’s hand” refers to the activity of the hand.

original: 'di'i 'du 'phrod kyi bya ba las me skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di'i 'du 'phrod kyi bya ba las me skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Fire arises from the activity of the contact of these two.

original: glo bur du zhes pa ni gang gi phyir rnam pa thams cad du yongs su btsal na me 'di mi dmigs so /
analyzed: glo bur du zhes pa ni gang gi phyir rnam pa thams cad du yongs su btsal na me 'di mi dmigs so /
translated: “Suddenly” means that if one searches for this fire in every way, it is not observed.

original: me de yang gtsub shing la yang mig nas gtsub stan la yang ma yin skyes bu'i lag pa dag la yang ma yin te //
analyzed: me de yang gtsub shing la yang mig nas gtsub stan la yang ma yin skyes bu'i lag pa dag la yang ma yin te //
translated: Moreover, that fire is not in the kindling, nor in the fire-drill, nor in the person’s hands,

original: rnam pa thams cad du yongs su btsal na gcig pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes pa ni de nyid kyi phyir glo bur du skye ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du yongs su btsal na gcig pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes pa ni de nyid kyi phyir glo bur du skye ste /
translated: because if one searches for it in every way, it does not exist as a unity. Therefore, it arises suddenly.

original: ma skyes pa nyid skyes par yongs su brtag go //
analyzed: ma skyes pa nyid skyes par yongs su brtag go //
translated: That which is not arisen is imagined to be arisen.

original: me de yang bden pa yang ma yin brdzun pa yang ma yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du chos rnams thams cad do //
analyzed: me de yang bden pa yang ma yin brdzun pa yang ma yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du chos rnams thams cad do //
translated: Just as that fire is neither true nor false, so it is with all phenomena.

original: lag pa'i bya ba yang bkod pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lag pa'i bya ba yang bkod pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The activity of the hand also does not exist as an arrangement,

original: bya ba rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because activities do not exist.

original: me yang me'i khams nyid kyi @170b cha shas med par bstan pa'i phyir yang cha shas dang bral ba las kyang khyad par cung zad byin gyis brlabs pa nges par bstan pa nye bar bstan to //
analyzed: me yang me'i khams nyid kyi @170b cha shas med par bstan pa'i phyir yang cha shas dang bral ba las kyang khyad par cung zad byin gyis brlabs pa nges par bstan pa nye bar bstan to //
translated: Fire is also taught to be partless in the aspect of the fire element itself. Therefore, a slight blessing is definitely taught to arise from that which is partless.

original: dbang po las 'das pa bden pa gnyis dbyer med par zung 'jug tu 'byung ba'i rim pa yin pas sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul te bla ma'i zhabs kyi bka' drin las khong du chud par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa bden pa gnyis dbyer med par zung 'jug tu 'byung ba'i rim pa yin pas sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul te bla ma'i zhabs kyi bka' drin las khong du chud par bya ba'o //
translated: Since this is the stage of the union of the two truths that transcends the senses, it is the domain of the buddhas. It should be understood through the kindness of the guru.

original: de ltar ni ae wam gyi ye ges rgyas btab pas so //
analyzed: de ltar ni ae wam gyi ye ges rgyas btab pas so //
translated: That is so because it is sealed with the syllable evam.

original: chos thams cad ni yul la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni yul la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: All phenomena are objects, and so on.

original: kye rnal 'byor mas ni bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: kye rnal 'byor mas ni bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: O yoginis!

original: yid la gyis shig ni chos kyi dbyings su zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: yid la gyis shig ni chos kyi dbyings su zhugs pa'o //
translated: Think of it!

original: de nas rnal 'byor ma bdag med ma la sogs pa rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma thams cad bdud rtsi lnga dang dam tshig gi rdzas thogs nas /
analyzed: de nas rnal 'byor ma bdag med ma la sogs pa rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma thams cad bdud rtsi lnga dang dam tshig gi rdzas thogs nas /
translated: Then all the vajra dakinis, such as Vajranairatmya, holding the five amrtas and samaya substances,

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje dpa' la mchod de rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa ni rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje dpa' la mchod de rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa ni rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Having worshipped the Blessed One Vajraviras, Vajrasattva is the nature of the Dharmakaya, the indivisibility of the three vajras.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One is endowed with the qualities of lordship, etc.

original: mchod pa ni de mngon par dang pa'i thugs kyis de mnyam pa nyid du bdag nyid kyi thugs la rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: mchod pa ni de mngon par dang pa'i thugs kyis de mnyam pa nyid du bdag nyid kyi thugs la rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: Worship is the establishment of his mind in the equality of himself by his mind of manifest faith in that.

original: ci byas nas she na thogs nas so //
analyzed: ci byas nas she na thogs nas so //
translated: Having done what? Having taken.

original: bdud rtsi lnga ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
translated: The five nectars are Vairochana, etc.

original: dam tshig gi rdzas ni go ku da ha na la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig gi rdzas ni go ku da ha na la sogs pa'o //
translated: The pledge substances are go, ku, da, ha, na, etc.

original: 'di 'dra ba nyid ni des pa kho nar yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam yin par sems brtan par bskyed nas bdud rtsi lnga ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga la dam tshig gi rdzas ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba nyid ni des pa kho nar yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam yin par sems brtan par bskyed nas bdud rtsi lnga ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga la dam tshig gi rdzas ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'dus pa'o //
translated: Having generated the firm thought that this alone is the path to perfect enlightenment, the five nectars are the five Tathagatas, and the pledge substances are the assembly of all Tathagatas.

original: 'dis byang chub kyi sems brtan par byas pas mchod pa yin par gsungs pa'i don nyid do //
analyzed: 'dis byang chub kyi sems brtan par byas pas mchod pa yin par gsungs pa'i don nyid do //
translated: This is the very meaning of the statement that the worship is by means of the firming of the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: bcom ldan 'das kun du ru'i sbyor bas rjes su chags par byed ces sbyar ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kun du ru'i sbyor bas rjes su chags par byed ces sbyar ro //
translated: The Blessed One is to be worshipped by means of the practice of Samvara.

original: yang na gnyis su med par rtogs pas byang chub kyi sems rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: yang na gnyis su med par rtogs pas byang chub kyi sems rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Or else, the Thought of Enlightenment is established by means of the realization of nonduality.

original: rdo rje bdud rtsi'i ro yang 'thud du 'jug par byed do ni bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: rdo rje bdud rtsi'i ro yang 'thud du 'jug par byed do ni bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The Blessed One is to be worshipped by means of the tasting of the vajra-ambrosia.

original: yang na bdud rtsi ni byang chub sems so //
analyzed: yang na bdud rtsi ni byang chub sems so //
translated: Or else, ambrosia is the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: de'i ro ni nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid bstar ba'o //
analyzed: de'i ro ni nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid bstar ba'o //
translated: Its taste is the experience-trait of the stream.

original: yang na bsdu ba rang bzhin gyis brlab par byas pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang na bsdu ba rang bzhin gyis brlab par byas pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Or else, the collection is the very consecration by nature.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das dgyes nas rang byin gyis @171a * //🔽brlab pa bstan pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das dgyes nas rang byin gyis @171a * //🔽brlab pa bstan pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One, being pleased, taught the self-consecration.

original: 'dis ni rdo rje rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi kun du ru'i sbyor bas rjes su chags pa'i bar bdud rtsi bcud kyis len gyis kyang bcom ldan 'das mnyes te bcom ldan 'das ma yang mnyes pas bcom ldan 'das kyis rang byin gyis brlab pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni rdo rje rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi kun du ru'i sbyor bas rjes su chags pa'i bar bdud rtsi bcud kyis len gyis kyang bcom ldan 'das mnyes te bcom ldan 'das ma yang mnyes pas bcom ldan 'das kyis rang byin gyis brlab pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows the consecration of nectar, by the yoga of the universal vajra yoginis, which pleases the Lord, and also pleases the Lady, and so the Lord teaches the self-consecration.

original: kye kye rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma //
analyzed: kye kye rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma //
translated: O O Vajra dakini,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyis phyag mdzad pa'i //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyis phyag mdzad pa'i //
translated: the reality which is saluted by all the Buddhas,

original: de nyid bdag gis gsang byas pas //
analyzed: de nyid bdag gis gsang byas pas //
translated: I will explain it, having kept it secret.

original: rdo rje mchod pa'i byin rlabs kyis //
analyzed: rdo rje mchod pa'i byin rlabs kyis //
translated: By the consecration of the vajra worship,

original: bshad kyis dad pas rab tu nyon //
analyzed: bshad kyis dad pas rab tu nyon //
translated: listen with faith, I will explain.

original: gsang byas pa ni gang nyan thos la sogs pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i de kho na nyid de bshad par bya yis //
analyzed: gsang byas pa ni gang nyan thos la sogs pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i de kho na nyid de bshad par bya yis //
translated: The secret is the reality which is not the domain of experience of the sravakas and so on, and that I will explain.

original: dad pas nyon zhes pa ni nyan pa'i dbang pos zung shig pa ste //
analyzed: dad pas nyon zhes pa ni nyan pa'i dbang pos zung shig pa ste //
translated: Listen with faith means grasp it with the faculty of hearing.

original: brjod du med pa nyid tshig gis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: brjod du med pa nyid tshig gis bstan pa'o //
translated: The inexpressible itself is taught by words.

original: byin rlabs kyi ni bcom ldan 'das kyis byin rlabs 'di'o //
analyzed: byin rlabs kyi ni bcom ldan 'das kyis byin rlabs 'di'o //
translated: The consecration is the consecration of the Lord.

analyzed: yang na byin rlabs bstan pa ni sprul pa'i skus chos kyi sku dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dbyer med par rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
translated: Or else, the teaching of the consecration is that the Emanation Body is perfected in the indivisibility of the Reality Body and the Enjoyment Body.

analyzed: yang na kun du ru'i sbyor ba ni rdo rje dang padma mnyam par sbyor bas so //

analyzed: rjes su zhes pa ni rim pas chags par gyur pa ste chags pa dang / chags pa bar ma dang / chags pa chen po rnam par dga' ba la thug par de thob pa'o //
translated: The subsequent is the sequence of passion, which is the attainment of that passion, middling passion, and great passion, up to the climax.

original: de nas rdo rje bdud rtsi'i ro yang 'thung ngu 'jug par byed do zhes pa la bdud rtsi ni khu ba'o //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje bdud rtsi'i ro yang 'thung ngu 'jug par byed do zhes pa la bdud rtsi ni khu ba'o //

analyzed: ro ni bden pa chen po yin pas bdud rtsi'i ro'o //

original: de rdo rje ni dbyer mi phyed pa'o //
analyzed: de rdo rje ni dbyer mi phyed pa'o //

original: de 'thung du 'jug par byed pa ni de rtogs pas tshim pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis bzhi pa rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: de 'thung du 'jug par byed pa ni de rtogs pas tshim pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis bzhi pa rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The causing to drink is the completion of the fourth by the nature of satisfaction through the realization of that.

original: de nas rgyu de gnyis kyi phyir bzhi pa nyid rgyu'o //
analyzed: de nas rgyu de gnyis kyi phyir bzhi pa nyid rgyu'o //
translated: Then, the fourth itself is the cause for those two reasons.

original: gang phyi nas tha mar gyur pa ni gang gi phyir bzhi pa nyid la thug pa de nyid bcom ldan 'das yin par brjod do //
analyzed: gang phyi nas tha mar gyur pa ni gang gi phyir bzhi pa nyid la thug pa de nyid bcom ldan 'das yin par brjod do //
translated: The one who is last, in the end, is the Lord himself, because he is the fourth.

analyzed: dgyes nas ni chags pa thams cad mnyam snyoms su gnas pa'i rang bzhin gyis bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The one who is pleased is the Lord, because he is the nature of the equality of all attachments.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa bstan pa ni /

analyzed: thams cad du khyab pa'i phyir dus thams cad las te //

original: rnam pa thams cad sdom pa gcig pa'i phyir yang ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad sdom pa gcig pa'i phyir yang ngo //

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bstan pa ni sprul pa'i sku sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin dbang po'i gzhu dang mtshungs pa'i sprul pa'i sku 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the teaching is the arising of the emanation body, which has the nature of various emanation bodies, which is like a rainbow.

analyzed: de nas sprul pa'i sku las longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //

original: kye kye rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma //
analyzed: kye kye rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma //

analyzed: bshad kyis rab tu @171b nyon zhes pa ni gnyi ga yang bod pa ste /

original: dbyer med pa ni nam mkha' la spyod pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: dbyer med pa ni nam mkha' la spyod pa'i sgra'o //

original: de yang de dang dbyer med pa nyid chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: de yang de dang dbyer med pa nyid chos kyi sku'o //

analyzed: gsang mdzad pa'i ni chos kyi sku 'di dbang po las 'das pa'o //

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /

original: mchod pa zhes pa ni mchod pa'i bya ba ste /
analyzed: mchod pa zhes pa ni mchod pa'i bya ba ste /

original: rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i ye shes so //

analyzed: de nyid rdo rje ste rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //

analyzed: de nyid byin brlabs ni shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi rang bzhin kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //

analyzed: de dang dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis yin par dgongs so //
translated: It is considered to be by the very nature of the indivisibility of that.

original: bdag gis zhes pa ni bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bdag gis zhes pa ni bdag nyid do //

original: sangs rgyas kun gyis ni me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes lngas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyis ni me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes lngas so //

analyzed: phyag mdzad pa ni rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa nyid kyis nges pa'o //
translated: The homage is the certainty by the indivisibility of the three vajras.

original: de nas lha mo thams cad rangs par gyur te pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas /

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rangs par gyur ni spro ba dang bsdu ba'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes so //

analyzed: de nas zhes pa ni bden pa gnyis dbyer med par rtogs pa'o //

analyzed: btud nas ni sku gsung thugs dbyer med pas so //

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung nyan par gyur to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung nyan par gyur to //

original: da ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: da ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad las rnam par grol pas spros pa med pa'i spyod pas 'khyam pa yin par dgongs so //

translated: “Eat and drink whatever is found and do not reject” means that the appearances and expressions of everything are pure.

original: nang gi lha'i rang bzhin las sems g-yo ba med pas /
analyzed: nang gi lha'i rang bzhin las sems g-yo ba med pas /

analyzed: phyi rol gyi lha'i rnam par rtog pa yid dga' ba med pa'i phyir / rdo shing 'jim pa'i rang bzhin gyi //

analyzed: lha 'di rnams mdun du byung ba na phyag mi bya zhes pa'o //

original: yang na bshes kyi sgras dbang ba rnams so //
analyzed: yang na bshes kyi sgras dbang ba rnams so //

original: sdug pa ni chags pas te de mi bya'o //
analyzed: sdug pa ni chags pas te de mi bya'o //

original: sdug pa zhes pa ma ning ste /

analyzed: byams pa bsgom pas mnyam pa nyid kyi ma ning nyid kyi phyir ro //

analyzed: gdug la sdang zhes pa gdug pa'i sems la zhe sdang gnyis 'dod par mi bya ste /

original: sdang zhes pa ma ning gnyis su med pas so //
analyzed: sdang zhes pa ma ning gnyis su med pas so //
translated: “Hate” is a neuter word, because of the nonduality.

original: lha ni rol par byed pa ste 'di rnams la rol pa de yod pa'i phyir lha yul rnams so //🔽lha de rnams la @173a * //
analyzed: lha ni rol par byed pa ste 'di rnams la rol pa de yod pa'i phyir lha yul rnams so // lha de rnams la @173a * //

original: phyag mi bya ste de'i mngon par zhen pa med par bya'o //
analyzed: phyag mi bya ste de'i mngon par zhen pa med par bya'o //

original: khyad par ci zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ci zhe na /

analyzed: rdo shing 'jim pa'i rang bzhin rnams te bems po'i rnam par rtog pas rnam par gnas zhes dgongs pa'o //

original: rigs lnga la ni mnyam par spyad /
analyzed: rigs lnga la ni mnyam par spyad /

original: ces mdor bstan pa'i don sangs rgyas par bshad pas /
analyzed: ces mdor bstan pa'i don sangs rgyas par bshad pas /

original: g-yung mo gdol pa ko lpags mkhan //
analyzed: g-yung mo gdol pa ko lpags mkhan //

original: phyag dar mkhan sogs reg ring dang // bram ze rgyal rigs rje dmangs rnams //
analyzed: phyag dar mkhan sogs reg ring dang // bram ze rgyal rigs rje dmangs rnams //

original: bdag gi lus ltar reg par bya //
analyzed: bdag gi lus ltar reg par bya //

original: zhes pa don rab tu gsal ba kho na'o //
analyzed: zhes pa don rab tu gsal ba kho na'o //

analyzed: bdag gi lus ltar zhes pa sems kyi lus nyid kyi phyir rang gi lus lta bur chos thams cad las reg par bya'o //

analyzed: sems de yang chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin nyid du rtogs par bya'o zhes pa'o //

original: bdud rtsi lnga dang bu ram chang //
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga dang bu ram chang //

original: dug dang nim pa bu btsas skyes //
analyzed: dug dang nim pa bu btsas skyes //

original: skyur dang mngar dang bska ba sogs //
analyzed: skyur dang mngar dang bska ba sogs //

analyzed: kha ba lan tshva tsha ba dang // dri ba dri zhim chung dang khrag / byang chub sems bsres rab tu bza' //

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /

original: gnyis med ye shes sems kyis ni //
analyzed: gnyis med ye shes sems kyis ni //

original: mi bza' cung zad yod ma yin //
analyzed: mi bza' cung zad yod ma yin //

original: rang byung me tog rnyed nas ni //
analyzed: rang byung me tog rnyed nas ni //

original: padma'i snod du gzhag bya zhing //
analyzed: padma'i snod du gzhag bya zhing //

original: lud pa dang ni snabs dag gis //
analyzed: lud pa dang ni snabs dag gis //

analyzed: gcig tu byas nas btung bar bya'o // zhes pa ni /

original: 'di'i don to //
analyzed: 'di'i don to //

analyzed: de nas rang byung me tog khu ba dang bde ba'i rnam pa dbyer med pas byang chub kyi sems btung zhing bsdu bar bya'o //

analyzed: rnyed pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes 'di nyid ces pa nges pa'i don to //

original: rang byung me tog rnyed nas ni //
analyzed: rang byung me tog rnyed nas ni //
translated: Having found the self-arisen flower,🔽one should drink it.

original: btung bar @173b bya zhes pa'i bar gyis thugs rdo rje'i mngon par zhen pa yongs su spang ba'o //
analyzed: btung bar @173b bya zhes pa'i bar gyis thugs rdo rje'i mngon par zhen pa yongs su spang ba'o //
translated: Up to here, the manifest clinging to the mind vajra is completely abandoned.

original: lud pa dang ni snabs dag ni //
analyzed: lud pa dang ni snabs dag ni //
translated: Sputum and mucus

original: padma'i snod du gzhag bya zhing //
analyzed: padma'i snod du gzhag bya zhing //
translated: should be placed in a lotus vessel.

analyzed: zhes pa'i bar gyis gsung rdo rje'i mngon par zhes pa yongs su spong ba'o //

analyzed: smad g-yogs kha dog sna tshogs dang / ro bsregs thal bas de bzhin brgyan //

analyzed: mgo skyes mchog ni bcing bar bya //

analyzed: sna tshogs kyi skras rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa thugs rdo rje'o //

analyzed: ci ltar zhe na //

analyzed: de nas rdo rje snying pos gsol pa /

analyzed: gang rnams she na dbang po rnams te /

original: mig la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnams so //

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sems dpa' che zhes pa ni rdo rje snying po la bos pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the one called the great being is addressed as the vajra essence.

analyzed: sems dpa' chen po ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin pa las gang gi phyir longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yis 'gro ba'i don byed pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The great being is the sambhogakaya, because the sambhogakaya engages in benefiting beings.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rdo rje snying po yang sdud pa po yin par brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rdo rje snying po yang sdud pa po yin par brjod do //

original: 'dis ci bstan na /🔽skye bo mi bzad pa yi las //
analyzed: 'dis ci bstan na / skye bo mi bzad pa yi las //

analyzed: @174b gang dang gang gis 'ching 'gyur ba //

original: thabs dang bcas na de nyid kyis //
analyzed: thabs dang bcas na de nyid kyis //
translated: by that very thing, if accompanied by means,

original: srid pa'i 'ching las grol bar 'gyur //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'ching las grol bar 'gyur //

original: zhes pa dang / gzhan yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / gzhan yang gsungs pa /

analyzed: srid pa nyid kyis srid pa dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa'o // da ni dbang po'i rnam par dag pa zhus pa /

analyzed: rnam pa ma dag par dag pa lta bu'i dag pa yin par shes nas //
translated: Now, having understood that the purification of the faculties is like a purification that is impure,

analyzed: dam tshig gi brda tha snyad du mtshon dka' ba yin par blo la bzhag nas //
translated: and having placed in the mind that the symbolic conventions of the commitments are difficult to illustrate,

original: rdo rje snying pos gsol pa /
analyzed: rdo rje snying pos gsol pa /
translated: Vajragarbha made a request:

original: gsang ba'i skad ni ci zhes bgyi //
analyzed: gsang ba'i skad ni ci zhes bgyi //
translated: What is the secret language?

original: rnal 'byor ma yi dam tshig che //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma yi dam tshig che //
translated: The great commitment of the yoginīs

original: nyan thos la sogs mi shes pa /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs mi shes pa /
translated: is not known by the śrāvakas and so on.

original: dgod dang lta ba dag gis dang // 'khyud dang de bzhin gnyis gnyis kyis //
analyzed: dgod dang lta ba dag gis dang // 'khyud dang de bzhin gnyis gnyis kyis //
translated: By laughing, looking, embracing, and likewise by the two together,

original: rgyud kyang rnam pa bzhi rnams kyi //
analyzed: rgyud kyang rnam pa bzhi rnams kyi //
translated: the tantra is also of four kinds.

original: dgongs pa'i skad ni ma bsgrags pa //
analyzed: dgongs pa'i skad ni ma bsgrags pa //
translated: The intentional language has not been proclaimed.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This is

analyzed: 'dus pa'i skad dam dgongs pa'i skad do // bsnos pa ni 'dus pa ste /
translated: the language of the assembly, or the intentional language.

original: n'a da gnyis dbyer med pa'i n'a da'o //
analyzed: n'a da gnyis dbyer med pa'i n'a da'o //
translated: “ Assembly” is a variant of “inseparable” (nāda).

original: de yang rnal 'byor ma'i ni bdag med ma la sogs pa'i lo dam tshig ni 'byung ba la de yang ma ning gi skad kyi dam tshig kyang ngo //
analyzed: de yang rnal 'byor ma'i ni bdag med ma la sogs pa'i lo dam tshig ni 'byung ba la de yang ma ning gi skad kyi dam tshig kyang ngo //
translated: Moreover, the yoginīs’ pledge is to be in accord with the non-dual, which is the non-dual sound.

original: de yang nyan thos la sogs pas mi phyed pa'o //
analyzed: de yang nyan thos la sogs pas mi phyed pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is not to be divided by the Śrāvakas, etc.

original: dgongs pa'i skad ces pa'i phyogs ltar na /
analyzed: dgongs pa'i skad ces pa'i phyogs ltar na /
translated: If one follows the position of the “intentional language,”

original: nyin mo dang mtshan mo gnyis dbyer med pa'i skad cig ni thun mtshams so //
analyzed: nyin mo dang mtshan mo gnyis dbyer med pa'i skad cig ni thun mtshams so //
translated: the “time” is the moment of the indivisibility of day and night.

original: snang ba dang snang ba mched pa dang snang ba thob pa gang de bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba dang snang ba mched pa dang snang ba thob pa gang de bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: That which is to be accomplished is the appearance, the appearance-increase, and the appearance-gain.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i skad kyi rgyu mtshan ni ma ning ngo //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i skad kyi rgyu mtshan ni ma ning ngo //
translated: The “sign of the sound” is the non-dual.

original: de nyid rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi dam tshig yin par gsungs pa'i don nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi dam tshig yin par gsungs pa'i don nyid do //
translated: That itself is said to be the pledge of the yoginīs.

original: yang na 'dus pa'i skad ces pa ni skyes pa dang bud med dang ma ning gi rang bzhin 'dus pas rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa nyid kyi skad gang gzhom du med pa'i rang bzhin 'od gsal gyi ye shes so //
analyzed: yang na 'dus pa'i skad ces pa ni skyes pa dang bud med dang ma ning gi rang bzhin 'dus pas rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa nyid kyi skad gang gzhom du med pa'i rang bzhin 'od gsal gyi ye shes so //
translated: Or else, the word “assembly” is the indivisibility of the three vajras, the nature of the assembly of the natures of male, female, and neuter, which is the indestructible nature, the pristine awareness of luminous clarity.

original: de nyid rnal 'byor ma'i dam tshig ni 'di la yod pas rnal 'byor ma ste phul du byung ba'i don 'di las rtag pa nyid du rnal 'byor dang ldan zhing stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid rnal 'byor ma'i dam tshig ni 'di la yod pas rnal 'byor ma ste phul du byung ba'i don 'di las rtag pa nyid du rnal 'byor dang ldan zhing stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: That itself is the commitment of the yoginī, because it exists here. The yoginī is the one who is always endowed with yoga in this supreme meaning, the nature of the indivisibility of emptiness and compassion.

original: de la dam tshig ni de dang shin tu dbyer med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cas 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: de la dam tshig ni de dang shin tu dbyer med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cas 'dus pa'o //
translated: The commitment in that is the assembly of all tathāgatas, who are utterly indivisible from that.

original: de yang ma ning gi dam tshig go //
analyzed: de yang ma ning gi dam tshig go //
translated: That is also the commitment of the neuter.

original: de yang nyan thos la sogs mi shes pa ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnams kyis mtshon par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: de yang nyan thos la sogs mi shes pa ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnams kyis mtshon par mi nus pa'o //
translated: That is also unknowable by śrāvakas and so on, indicated by the apprehension of signs and so on.

original: gang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa brgyad stong pa las gsungs pa /🔽bdag @175a * //🔽spyod pa zhes spyod na mtshan ma la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa brgyad stong pa las gsungs pa / bdag @175a * // spyod pa zhes spyod na mtshan ma la spyod pa'o //
translated: Whatever the Lord has said in the noble Eight Thousand:🔽If one engages in the thought I am a bodhisattva, one engages in a sign.

original: bdag byang chub sems dpa' zhes spyod na mtshan ma la spyod pa ste /
analyzed: bdag byang chub sems dpa' zhes spyod na mtshan ma la spyod pa ste /
translated: If one engages in the thought I am a bodhisattva, one engages in a sign.

original: 'dis thabs la mi mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yin par rig par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dis thabs la mi mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yin par rig par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: By this, one should know that the bodhisattva mahāsattva is unskilled in means.

original: 'di ji ltar yin pa de gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar yin pa de gsungs pa /
translated: How is this? He says:

original: gang gi phyir 'dus pa'i skad dam thun mtshams kyi skad kyang rung ste ma bsgrags pa ni ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dus pa'i skad dam thun mtshams kyi skad kyang rung ste ma bsgrags pa ni ma bstan pa'o //
translated: Because it is not proclaimed, not taught, whether in the language of the assembly or in the language of the session.

original: gang gis she na rgyud kyis te bye brag tu bshad pas so //
analyzed: gang gis she na rgyud kyis te bye brag tu bshad pas so //
translated: By whom? By the lineage, by the commentary.

original: gang rnams kyi zhen rnam pa bzhi rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gang rnams kyi zhen rnam pa bzhi rnams kyi'o //
translated: Of whom? Of the four kinds.

original: bzhi po nyid gang gi yin pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: bzhi po nyid gang gi yin pa gsungs pa /
translated: He says just what the four are:

original: dgod dang lta ba dag gis kyang //
analyzed: dgod dang lta ba dag gis kyang //
translated: By laughter and by looking,

original: kyang gi sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don to //
analyzed: kyang gi sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don to //
translated: The word also has the meaning of because.

original: 'khyud dang de bzhin gnyis gnyis kyis //
analyzed: 'khyud dang de bzhin gnyis gnyis kyis //
translated: By embracing and likewise by the two,

original: zhes pa ni ji ltar 'khyud pa dang gnyis gnyis de bzhin du yin pa nyid kyi don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ji ltar 'khyud pa dang gnyis gnyis de bzhin du yin pa nyid kyi don to //
translated: This is the meaning of “just as it is embraced” and “the two are just like that.”

original: 'dis ci bstan na /
analyzed: 'dis ci bstan na /
translated: What is shown by this?

original: bya ba dang spyod pa dang rnal 'byor bla na med pa'i rgyud kyis kyang dgongs pa'i skad ma gsungs pa nyid nyan thos pa la sogs pa'i yang spyod yul ma yin pa 'di dgongs pa'i skad 'di ma ning yin no //
analyzed: bya ba dang spyod pa dang rnal 'byor bla na med pa'i rgyud kyis kyang dgongs pa'i skad ma gsungs pa nyid nyan thos pa la sogs pa'i yang spyod yul ma yin pa 'di dgongs pa'i skad 'di ma ning yin no //
translated: The language of intention is not spoken by the tantras of action, conduct, and yoga, and it is not the domain of the hearers and so on. This language of intention is neuter.

original: yang na 'dus pa'i skad dam dgongs pa'i skad kyang rung ste /
analyzed: yang na 'dus pa'i skad dam dgongs pa'i skad kyang rung ste /
translated: Or, it is the language of the assembly or the language of intention.

original: dgongs pa'i skad ni ma grags pa //
analyzed: dgongs pa'i skad ni ma grags pa //
translated: The language of intention is not renowned.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This is the meaning of the above quote.

original: bzhi pa sgra'i yul ma yin pa ste mtshan ma las shin tu 'das nas cha med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzhi pa sgra'i yul ma yin pa ste mtshan ma las shin tu 'das nas cha med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Fourth, it is not an object of sound because it is beyond all characteristics and is partless.

original: gang rnams kyi zhe na /
analyzed: gang rnams kyi zhe na /
translated: Whose?

original: rnam pa bzhi rnams kyis zhes pa ni dga' ba la sogs pa lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i mtha' rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi rnams kyis zhes pa ni dga' ba la sogs pa lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i mtha' rnams kyi'o //
translated: The four aspects are joy and so on, ending with connate joy.

original: gang gis she na rgyud kyis te bye brag tu bshad pas so //
analyzed: gang gis she na rgyud kyis te bye brag tu bshad pas so //
translated: By what? By the tantras, the commentaries.

original: gang dag gis she na /
analyzed: gang dag gis she na /
translated: By whom?

original: dgod dang lta ba dag gis kyang ste rnam pa sna tshogs dang rnam par sbyin pa dag gis so //
analyzed: dgod dang lta ba dag gis kyang ste rnam pa sna tshogs dang rnam par sbyin pa dag gis so //
translated: Also by means of laughter and gazing, and by means of various kinds of giving.

original: 'khyud dang de bzhin gnyis gnyis kyi //
analyzed: 'khyud dang de bzhin gnyis gnyis kyi //
translated: Embracing and likewise the two-by-two

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: means
